content.description: Goes right at start then up fun face.
content.location: Located just right of On the Dole and just left of Angel of Mercy.

content.description:
A year ago, on Dec 10, 2015, my wife, dog and I found this little climb. It starts from behind the platform where the other Miller Time routes top out. There is some loose rock. Sorry about the name â€” I had to think of something.

The nesting-closure signs are well below the start of this route, so it may not be subject to the seasonal closure, which begins on Dec 15, every year.
content.protection: I slung chockstones in the wide crack and placed cams where it pinched down. For part of the top anchor, I placed a chockstone and slung it.  I lowered my wife before walking off.
content.location: This is on the highest tier of rock behind the platform where the other Miller Time routes end.  Big view of Ramona, etc.

content.description: Goes over little roof at bottom.  Several ways to do it.

Face climbing up sticky rock with just enough features to provide a pleasant climb to the top.  Notable by its low angled textury rock. Half way up a small bush is growing out of an obvious horizontal crack.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a cam or two in the .3-1" range for the horizontal crack.
content.location: On your left side halfway down the hill to the base of the Miller Time Wall, approaching from skier's right.

content.description: Starts traversing right on hand traverse.  Can use a blue tcu also.  Then up a nice face.
content.protection: Bolts plus blue tcu to orange Metolius.  Bolts are rusty so the cams are for backup.  Can backup belay with 0.6 inch cam
